title: Editing a Job
intro: A Job may be stopped but certain elements can be edited after the fact which allows post-processing, organization and export of Jobs and their data. On both the web and on mobile devices, a User has the ability to edit certain parts of their own Jobs. Here we will have a look more in depth about how and why a User might want to do this.

blocks.content:
Once a Job is finished, there is no way to edit it's template responses or GPS acquisition data (other than to 'Continue' a Job and start acquiring data again) however it is possible to edit certain attributes and metadata of a Job such as it's title & description. This is achieved by selecting the 'Edit Job Info' action on the web and on mobile devices. Editing in this way does not require the Job to continued again.

There is a range of information that can edited (or added).

points.text: Name/Title: Defaults to the Template name if none is given
Description: Short additional description of the Job
Rating: Out of 5 star rating of the Job
Status: Availability of Job. Public, Private or Shared
Categories: Additional categorization; multiple can be selected.
Weather: Additional information to specify weather during Job creation.

blocks.content: On the web, editing Job metadata is achieved on the Edit Job Info panel which can be accessed below.
On mobile devices, the edit panel can be accessed using the Action panel and selecting 'Edit Job'.

blocks.caption:
With the addition of a dedicated panel, the Edit Job screen also shows additional information about a Jobs Template (if created from a Template) and easy interactions for setting the metadata elements described above in 3.4.4.1.

Tapping the top icon (indicating the Job cover) the User has the ability to select a different cover from the available image Logs that exist inside the Job.

blocks.content: A Job's cover defaults to the first image taken historically inside the Job. This can of course be changed as explained above.

There is one element of a Job that can be edited without having to Continue it. While viewing a Job (on the web only) the User has the ability, when viewing a Log attached to a Step for example, to edit the attached log by either deleting, or adding an missing media type that could be attached alongside the media type already existing in the Log.
It is not possible to add a new Log alongside a Step or existing Logs, only to edit existing Logs attached to a Step.
